parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; properly, to lead; by implication, to bring, drive, go, pass, or induce.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To howl, lament loudly, cry aloud, bewail. A reduplicated primary verb; to 'howl' or 'halloo', i.e. Shriek.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Hardship, misery, distress, toil. From talaiporos; wretchedness, i.e. Calamity.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Plural
str2: From epi and erchomai; to supervene, i.e. Arrive, occur, impend, attack, influence.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
